alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 6:14AM CDT until June 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern McCurtain County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Bowie County in northeastern Texas... Red River County in northeastern Texas... * Until 700 AM CDT. * At 614 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Raymond Gary State Park to 6 miles west of Manchester to near Powderly, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Idabel, Broken Bow, Bagwell, Manchester, Wright City, Valliant, Detroit, Avery, Millerton, Annona, Haworth, Garvin, Eagletown, Moon, Cerrogordo, Beaverdams, Goodlake, Goodwater and Shinewell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
